acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on a LD50 value of >5400 mg/kg for rats (Pesticide safety information (Japan Crop Protection Association) (1994)), the substance was classified as "Not classified".

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists
acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data. As relevant information, a LC50 value was >1.75 mg/L/4h for rats (Pesticide safety information (Japan Crop Protection Association) (1994)).

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on LD50 values of >5400 mg/kg and 8640 mg/kg for rats (Pesticide safety information (Japan Crop Protection Association) (1994)), the substance was classified into "Not classified".

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances are not available.

explosives.rationale: Classified into Not classified since the substance is classified into Division 5.1, PG II in UNRTDG (UN1457) though it contains chemical groups (-O-O-) associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases

flammable_solids.rationale: Classified into Not classified since the substance is not flammable (Weiss (2nd, 1986)).

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data from in vivo mutagenicity tests. From in vitro mutagenicity tests, there is a report of a negative Ames test (Pesticide safety information (Japan Crop Protection Association) (1994)).

oxidizing_solids.rationale: The substance is classified into Division 5.1, PG II in UNRTDG (UN1457).

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Classified into Not classified since the substance is not flammble (Weiss (2nd, 1986)).

self_heating_substances.rationale: Classified into Not classified since the substance is not flammble (Weiss (2nd, 1986)).

self_reactive_substances.rationale: The substance is classified as Oxidizing agents.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: In an eye primary irritation test with rabbits where 0.1 g powder was applied into the eye, corneal opacity or cloudiness, iris congestion, conjunctival redness and chemosis occurred and persisted to day 21 in the unwashed eye group. Since these findings were attributed to strong alkali calcium hydroxide formed by the hydrolysis of calcium peroxide in the moisture condition of the eye (Pesticide safety information (Japan Crop Protection Association) (1994)), the substance was classified into Category 1.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Since in a skin primary irritation test with rabbits where 0.5 g powder was applied on the skin for 4-hour, there were no changes in the skin at any observation time, the substance was considered not to be primary skin irritant (Pesticide safety information (Japan Crop Protection Association) (1994)). The substance was classified as "Not classified".

skin_sensitizer.rationale: Based on a report of negative for skin sensitization in a guinea pig maximization test where some animals in the treated group and control group showed slight erythema but animals in the positive control group showed obvious erythema, crust formation and edema (Pesticide safety information (Japan Crop Protection Association) (1994)), the substance was classified as "Not classified".

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Classified into Not classified since it can be judged that the substance does not form combustible gas from the information of "Reacts very slowly with water at room temperature to form limewater and oxygen gas".

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Although lethargy, piloerection and slight diuresis were observed immediately after oral administration of 8640 mg/kg to rats, these signs disappeared within 4 days and no gross pathological lesions were observed (Pesticide safety information (Japan Crop Protection Association)). Following dermal application to rats and mice at 5400 mg/kg, no abnormality was observed in general condition, treated area of the skin or necropsy (Pesticide safety information (Japan Crop Protection Association)). Additionally, when rats were exposed to 1.75 mg/L (dusts) by inhalation for 4-hour, no treatment-related death or signs were observed and the histopathological examination revealed no treatment-related findings (Pesticide safety information (Japan Crop Protection Association)). Based on the data, the substance corresponds to "Not classified" with oral and dermal exposures since no toxicity was observed at dose levels exceeding the upper limit of the guidance value range for Category 2. However, with inhalation routes, there are no data at a dose level near the cut-off value. Overall, classification was not possible.
